## Content Needed (How-To Guide Style)

### 1. Manage Personal Projects (~60-80 lines)

**Recipe: GTD-style task management**
```bash
# Create project
jit issue create --title "Learn Rust" \
  --label "type:epic" --label "project:learning" \
  --priority high

# Break down into actions
jit issue create --title "Complete Rust Book Chapter 1" \
  --label "type:task" --label "project:learning"

# Next actions query
jit query ready --filter "label:project:learning"

# Waiting for external input
jit issue update <id> --label "waiting-for:book-arrival" \
  --state backlog
```

**Cover:**
- GTD workflow (next actions, waiting, projects)
- Personal project organization
- Context labels (home, office, errands)
- Energy-level priorities
- Review workflow
- Simple tracking without overhead

### 2. Track Learning Goals (~80-100 lines)

**Recipe: Skill development tracking**
```bash
# Learning goal with milestones
jit issue create --title "Master Python" \
  --label "type:epic" --label "skill:python" \
  --gate course-complete --gate project-built

# Course as task
jit issue create --title "Complete Python Fundamentals course" \
  --label "type:task" --label "skill:python" \
  --gate exercises-done

# Define learning gates
jit gate define exercises-done \
  --title "All Exercises Completed" \
  --mode manual

jit gate define project-built \
  --title "Built Portfolio Project" \
  --mode manual

# Track progress
jit query label "skill:python"
```

**Cover:**
- Skill tracking as issues
- Course dependencies (sequential)
- Exercise/project completion gates
- Progress tracking
- Portfolio project requirements
- Learning milestones
- Time-boxing with labels

### 3. Organize Writing Projects (~80-100 lines)

**Recipe: Book/article workflow**
```bash
# Book project
jit issue create --title "Write: Programming Guide" \
  --label "type:epic" --label "book:prog-guide"

# Chapters with dependencies
jit issue create --title "Chapter 1: Introduction" \
  --label "type:task" --label "book:prog-guide" \
  --gate draft-complete --gate edited

jit issue create --title "Chapter 2: Setup" \
  --label "type:task" --label "book:prog-guide"

# Chapter 2 requires Chapter 1
jit dep add <chapter2-id> <chapter1-id>

# Writing gates
jit gate define draft-complete \
  --title "First Draft Complete" \
  --mode auto \
  --checker-command "test $(wc -w < chapter1.md) -ge 2000"

jit gate define edited \
  --title "Editor Review Complete" \
  --mode manual
```

**Cover:**
- Book/article structure
- Chapter dependencies (order)
- Word count gates
- Editor review gates
- Spell check automation
- Revision tracking
- Publication workflow

### 4. Plan Events (~60-80 lines)

**Recipe: Event task breakdown**
```bash
# Event planning
jit issue create --title "Tech Conference 2026" \
  --label "type:epic" --label "event:techconf" \
  --priority critical

# Tasks with dependencies
jit issue create --title "Book venue" \
  --label "type:task" --label "event:techconf"

jit issue create --title "Send invitations" \
  --label "type:task" --label "event:techconf"

# Invitations depend on venue
jit dep add <invitations-id> <venue-id>

# Approval gates
jit gate define budget-approved \
  --title "Budget Approved by Manager" \
  --mode manual
```

**Cover:**
- Event task breakdown
- Timeline dependencies
- Approval gates (budget, legal)
- Vendor coordination
- Checklist tracking
- Deadline management with labels
- Team assignments

### 5. Document Management (~60-80 lines)

**Recipe: Track document workflow**
```bash
# Document review process
jit issue create --title "Q4 Report" \
  --label "type:task" --label "doc:report" \
  --gate draft-done --gate fact-checked --gate approved

# Link document
jit doc add <report-id> reports/q4-2025.md \
  --label "Draft Report" --doc-type design

# Review gates
jit gate define fact-checked \
  --title "Facts Verified Against Sources" \
  --mode manual

jit gate define approved \
  --title "Stakeholder Approval" \
  --mode manual

# Track versions
jit doc history <report-id> reports/q4-2025.md
```

**Cover:**
- Document lifecycle
- Review workflows
- Approval chains
- Version tracking with doc history
- Multi-stakeholder reviews
- Reference material linking
